adjective.description: Necessary for (someone) as a duty or responsibility.
examples: it is incumbent on all decent people to concentrate on destroying this evil

adjective.description: (of an official or regime) currently holding office.
examples: the incumbent president had been defeated

noun.description: The holder of an office or post.

origin: Late Middle English (as a noun): from Anglo-Latin incumbens, incumbent-, from Latin incumbere lie or lean on, from in- upon + a verb related to cubare lie.
